page.title: 11Religion in Mousehole
page.content: {Mousehole,}after it was first visited by{John Wesley}in 1766, became a strong{Methodist}community. This is still in evidence by the two large {Chapels}that are still used in the village. Although today in 1985 both of the congregations could fit into just one of the buildings. The decline in the size of the congregations is partly due to the greater mobility of the community of today, where many more people leave the locality and even more from outside come to live in the area. This has a watering down effect and combined with the general decline in church attendance accounts for the smaller congregations. The{Church of England}followers at at Mousehole attend{Paul Parish Church which is further inland, about half a mile to the north.
